content:
At the Sydney Connectathon there was some interest by multiple organisations to organise a Connectathon track about the FHIR Mapping Language at the next WGM in San Antonio.
As there are now at least two public implementation available, I would really like this idea. The main focus would be on the following tasks:

  • Complete the tutorial of the FHIR Mapping Language and adjust it to the newest language features
  • Test the interoperability of StructureMaps generated by different tooling
  • Discuss language limitations seen in different projects

My question would now be if this could be submitted as a FHIR-I track? I could volunteer to organise the track. Anyone else in favour of this idea?
I can come in remotely - I won't be at the event unfortunately...
